title: Binaural Beatz (Headphone Surround)
description:
Binaural Beatz (Headphone Surround)

Binaural panning is the audio version of 3D and has nothing to do with binaural beats. It's an effect that combines panning, delay and doppler effects to create virtual surround sound with 2 channels. The result is a listening experience that transcends normally recorded stereo. It mimics the natural hearing cues created by our head and ears to create the impression of 3D sound when listening through headphones.

I'm a big surround music fan and made this album so I can listen it through headphones on a portable player. The sources are all surround versions of the tracks ripped from SACD's, DVDA's and DTS DVD's. It was a lot of work, and while a binaural track will never be as good as the original surround mix or recording, I'm quite pleased with the result.

Codec: FLAC
Sample rate: 44100 Hz
Bits per sample: 16
Aka: CD quality ;p
